topic: johnson & johnson strikes deal with u.s. government to lower drug prices

text: A major breakthrough has been announced in the pharmaceutical industry
Johnson & Johnson has struck a deal with the US government to lower medication prices
The agreement will affect several key prescription drugs
Including those used to treat common conditions like diabetes and high blood pressure
The goal is to make these life-saving medications more accessible to millions of Americans
The deal is the result of months of negotiation between Johnson & Johnson and the US government
Both parties worked tirelessly to find a mutually beneficial solution
Johnson & Johnson has agreed to reduce medication prices by an average of 20 percent
Some prices will be slashed by as much as 50 percent
The price reduction will provide significant cost savings for patients and taxpayers
The deal's impact on the broader pharmaceutical industry is still uncertain
It remains to be seen if other major drug manufacturers will follow suit
The agreement may have long-term effects on the healthcare landscape
And the ongoing efforts to make prescription medications more affordable for all Americans
